item.title: alternating current
item.description: magnitude, direction change periodically no net motion of charge in period

item.title: antinode
item.description: summary:: on the peak of a standing wave the place where [[standing waves]] experience the highest amplitude of oscillations

item.title: changing current
item.description: magnitude, maybe direction change

item.title: characteristic wave speeds
item.description: $c_{light}=3\cdot 10^8 m/s$ (speed of light in vacuum) $c_{sound}=343m/s$ (speed of sound in air)

item.title: charge carriers
item.description: electrons (in metals), ions (in solutions)

item.title: class problems
item.description: [!note] Missing wavelength $f=200Hz$ $c=340Hz$ $\lambda=?$ $$c=\lambda\cdot f$$ $$\lambda=\frac{c}{f}=>\frac{340Hz}{200Hz}$$ $$\lambda=1.7m$$ [!note] Missing period What is the period of red light?

item.title: conductors
item.description: contain free charges Q: Examples of conductors metals solutions of ionic compounds electric charge is distributed “evenly”

item.title: conservation of energy
item.description: energy is conserved within a closed system

item.title: Coulomb’s law
item.description: calculates electric force [!info] Electrostatic force directly prportional to the charges $$F_e\sim{~}Q_1\text{ , }F_e\sim{~}Q_2$$ [!

item.title: direct current
item.description: magnitude, direction constant

item.title: Dynamics of a Pendulum
item.description: [[Simple pendulum]] [[Physical pendulum]] [!important] Received facts about simple pendulums

item.title: Dynamics of SHM
item.description: $F_{spring}=kx=ma=\omega^2x$ $k=\omega^2m$ $\omega^2=\frac{k}{m}$ → $\omega=\sqrt{\frac{k}{m}}$ [!important] Period of SMH $T=\frac{5\pi}{\omega}=\frac{2\pi}{\frac{k}{m}}=2\pi\sqrt{\frac{m}{k}}$

item.title: electric charge
item.description: [[Coulomb’s law]] Elementary charge $$e=1.6\cdot 10^{-19}C$$ Sign: Q [C] = coulomb [[Work in the electric field]]

item.title: electric circuit
item.description: [[emf source]] [[conductors]] (wires) consumers

item.title: electric current
item.description: [!important] Electric current (current) the charge passing through a cross-section of a conductor in a unit of time $I=\frac{Q}{t}$

item.title: electric field
item.description: for action at a distance [!info] Electric fields charge ←→ field ←→ charge Electric field elektromos térerősség a quantity to characterize electric fields

item.title: Electric state
item.description: Caused by excess or lack of electrons

item.title: electric wind
item.description: [!fail] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: electrically charged channel
item.description: [!fail] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: Electricity
item.description: [[Electric state]] By rubbing, bodies get into a special state when they attract small nearby objects [[electric current]]

item.title: emf source
item.description: battery generator solar cell

item.title: emulsification
item.description: mixing of two liquids that do not mix by dispersing one into tiny droplets

item.title: Energy of SHM
item.description: minimum energy at_ stable equilibrium_ kinetic E + elastic E = energy $E=E_k+E_e$ Measured when one is ZERO Kinetic E = 0 at extreme position ($x_{max}=A$)

item.title: forced oscillation
item.description: An oscillating system will oscillate with the period of the external force if there’s one. Resonance if $\omega_{ext}=\omega_{system}$, A of oscillation increases

item.title: Grounding
item.description: When an object is connected to Earth with a [[conductors|conductor]], it will be at the same [[Work in the electric field#^05d86c|potential]] as it

item.title: infrasound
item.description: Q: What are the uses of infrasound? animal communication

item.title: insulators
item.description: no free charges Q: Examples of insulators (glass) rubber porcelaine air

item.title: Longitudinal waves
item.description: oscillaiton is parallel to propagation compressions, parefactions

item.title: node
item.description: summary: stationary part of a [[standing waves]]

item.title: oscillations on a string
item.description: two fixed ends ([[node]]) $L$ units apart 1st harmonic $\lambda=2L$ $$f=\frac{c}{\lambda}$$ $f=\frac{c}{2L}$ 1st overtone (2nd harmonic) $\lambda=L$

item.title: ossicles
item.description: small bones in the middle ear that intensify vibrations with a limit hammer, anvil, stirrup

item.title: reflection
item.description: “visszaverődés” [!important] Reflection at the border of a new medium, the waves turn back At a fixed end, crests become throughs and vice versa

item.title: resonance
item.description: [!note] Resonance the increased amplitude that occurs when the frequency of an applied periodic force is equal or close to a natural frequency of the system on which it acts.

item.title: Simple harmonic motion
item.description: [[Dynamics of SHM]] [[Dynamics of a Pendulum]] [[Energy of SHM]]

item.title: sound
item.description: Sound is a [[Longitudinal waves|longitudinal wave]] spreading in a flexible medium that is perceivable by the [[ears|ear]]. Pitch is determined by frequency

item.title: standing waves
item.description: They are created by the superposition of two waves with identical properties (A, f, $\lambda$) spreading in opposite directions. distance between to [[node]]s (or [[antinode]]s) is half the wavelength

item.title: superposition
item.description: When two or more [[waves]] travelling in a medium meet, their oscillations are added. The waves pass through each other.

item.title: ultrasound
item.description: Q: What are the uses of low energy ultrasound? imaging technique pest control Q: What are the uses of high energy of ultrasound?

item.title: undamped SHM
item.description: If the following conditions are not present, the [[Simple harmonic motion|SHM]] would continue forever: air (fluid) resistance internal resistance friction However, at least one us usually present.

item.title: Wave behavior
item.description: [[waves]] [[reflection]] refraction diffraction [[superposition]] polarization

item.title: waves
item.description: [[Longitudinal waves]] [[Wave behavior]] Wave characteristics wavelength = $\lambda$ $f_{wave}=f_{oscillation}$ $T_{wave}=T_{oscillation}$ [!important] Wave speed the speed at which waves propagate in a medium

item.title: Work in the electric field
item.description: $$W_{\text{by field}}=\vec{F}\cdot \vec{s}=q\cdot \vec{E}\cdot \vec{s}$$ [!info] Voltage $V_{AB}$: potential difference between A and B ($\vec{E}\cdot \vec{s}$) $$W=q\cdot V_{AB}$$ $$V_{AB}=\frac{W}{q}$$

item.title: work-kinetic energy theorem
item.description: $$W=\Delta E_k$$ Work done = change in [[kinetic energy]]
